title: Taylor Swiftâ€™s â€˜The Life of a Showgirlâ€™ Spends First Month at No. 1 on BillboardÂ 200
summary: Plus, Daniel Caesar, Brandi Carlile and Demi Lovato debut in the top 10.
body: Taylor Swift â€™s The Life of a Showgirl spends its first month atop the Billboard 200 chart, as it racks up its fourth straight week at No. 1 (on the chart dated Nov. 8). It earned 146,000 equivalent album units (down 25%) in the United States in the week ending Oct. 30, according to Luminate. The Life of a Showgirl is only the second album in 2025 to spend its first month at No. 1, following Morgan Wallenâ€™s Iâ€™m the Problem (which spent its first eight weeks atop the list, of its total 12 at No. 1). Swiftâ€™s own The Tortured Poets Department spent its first 12 weeks at No. 1 in 2024, of its total 17 weeks atop the list. With The Life of a Showgirl spending a fourth week at No. 1, Swift adds her 90th career week at No. 1 on the chart, extending her record among soloists . Elvis Presley has the second-most among soloists, with 67. The total encompasses her 15 No. 1 albums, the most among soloists. Only The Beatles have more weeks at No. 1 (132) and more No. 1 albums (19) among all artists. Also in the top 10 of the latest Billboard 200, new releases from Daniel Caesar, Brandi Carlile and Demi Lovato all debut. The Billboard 200 chart ranks the most popular albums of the week in the U.â€¦

title: Brandi Carlile Returns to â€˜SNLâ€™ to Perform Songs From â€˜Returning toÂ Myselfâ€™
summary: This marks Carlileâ€™s fourth time as musical guest on SNL and her second appearance this year, following an April duet with Elton John.
body: Brandi Carlile returned to Saturday Night Live on Nov. 2 with a commanding performance of â€œChurch & Stateâ€ and â€œHuman,â€ both from her newly released solo album Returning to Myself . This marks Carlileâ€™s fourth time as musical guest on SNL and her second appearance this year, following an April duet with Elton John promoting their joint project Who Believes in Angels? . On Saturdayâ€™s show, she took center stage solo, delivering two emotionally charged performances. Opening with â€œChurch & State,â€ Carlile sang of a â€œfailing empireâ€ and sociopolitical unrest in a haunting arrangement co-written with producer Andrew Watt and longtime collaborators Phil and Tim Hanseroth. She followed with â€œHuman,â€ a soaring ballad that reflects on vulnerability and resilience â€” also the name of her upcoming Human Tour, which kicks off in February 2026. The two songs are from Carlileâ€™s eighth studio album, Returning to Myself , released Oct. 25. It marks her first solo LP since 2021â€™s In These Silent Days , which peaked at No. 11 on the Billboard 200, topped the Rock and Americana/Folk charts, and won multiple Grammy awards, including Best Americana Album and awards for â€œBroken Horses.â€ It also â€¦

title: Jessica Simpson Marks 8 Years of Sobriety: â€˜Alcohol Silenced My Intuitionâ€™
summary: â€œ8 years ago today I made the choice to confront, to confess and to let go of the self-sabotaging parts of my life that I was choosing,â€ Simpson wrote.
body: Jessica Simpson is celebrating eight years of sobriety. The singer, fashion entrepreneur and reality TV personality marked the milestone on Friday (Nov. 1) with a reflective Instagram post , sharing how giving up alcohol transformed her life and creativity. â€œ8 years ago today I made the choice to confront, to confess and to let go of the self-sabotaging parts of my life that I was choosing,â€ Simpson wrote. â€œMaking that decision allowed me to fully live in the pursuit of Godâ€™s purpose for my life. Alcohol silenced my intuition, blocked my dreams and chased my circulating fears of complacency.â€ She continued, â€œToday I am clear. Today I am driven by faith. Both fear and faith are something that we feel and may not see, Iâ€™m so happy I chose faith over fear. It was not in the fight that I found my strength, it was in the surrender.â€ View this post on Instagram A post shared by Jessica Simpson (@jessicasimpson) The â€œWith Youâ€ singer has been open about her journey to sobriety since revealing in her 2020 memoir Open Book that she quit drinking in 2017. Earlier this year, Simpson told The Cut that getting sober also reshaped her songwriting process. â€œEvery time I would write, I was a littâ€¦

title: Tame Impala Resurrects â€˜Sundown Syndromeâ€™ at Halloween BarclaysÂ Show
summary: Comedian and longtime Tame Impala fan Eric Andre made an unexpected cameo.
body: Tame Impala pulled a few tricksâ€”and fan-favorite treatsâ€”out of the vault on Halloween night in Brooklyn. Related 6 Best Moments From Tame Impala’s Deadbeat Tour Opener in Brooklyn Brandi Carlile Returns to 'SNL' to Perform Songs From 'Returning to Myself' Jessica Simpson Marks 8 Years of Sobriety: 'Alcohol Silenced My Intuition' Kevin Parker brought his Deadbeat Tour to Barclays Center on Thursday (Oct. 31), performing the live rarity â€œSundown Syndromeâ€ for the first time in seven years. The psych-pop gem, originally released as Tame Impalaâ€™s debut single in 2009, hadnâ€™t appeared on a tour setlist since 2018. The moment came midway through night three of a four-night sold-out run at the arena, with Parker and his touring band all dressed in costumes nodding to Parkerâ€™s â€œscarf-eraâ€ aesthetic from the early 2010s. The Halloween chaos didnâ€™t stop there. Comedian and longtime Tame Impala fan Eric Andre made an unexpected cameoâ€”inside the showâ€™s bathroom cam. Parker has famously included a backstage toilet feed on tour to give fans a surreal behind-the-scenes moment mid-set. This time, Andre took over the screen, sharing a quick on-camera kiss wâ€¦

title: Drake Supports Hometown Blue Jays at Game 6 of the WorldÂ Series
summary: Also attending the game were Rush frontman Geddy Lee, Schittâ€™s Creek stars Eugene Levy and Annie Murphy and more.
body: Drake stepped out in full hometown hero mode on Halloween night (Oct. 31), attending Game 6 of the 2025 World Series at Rogers Centre in Toronto as the Blue Jays attempted to clinch their first championship since 1993. The rapper, who has been trolling Los Angeles Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani on social media throughout the series, was among a stacked lineup of celebrities cheering on the Jays in their showdown against L.A. â€œOctoberâ€™s Very Own is back at the #WorldSeries,â€ MLB captioned a post on X , sharing footage of Drake arriving in the stadium. His appearance was part of a Halloween-night spectacle that included a whoâ€™s who of Canadian royalty and celebrity fans. Also attending the game were Rush frontman Geddy Lee, Schittâ€™s Creek stars Eugene Levy and Annie Murphy, former tennis pro Eugenie Bouchard, and Sliders actor Jerry Oâ€™Connell. Baseball legends Paul Molitor and Jack Morris â€” both World Series MVPs with the Blue Jays and Twins respectively â€” were also spotted in the stands. Drakeâ€™s recent Instagram Story posts have only amplified his sports-fan persona. After Game 5, he shared a photo of Ohtani wearing a sweater vest, cheekily captioned â€œONE MORE!!!!!!!â€ before following â€¦

title: Mariah Carey Announces â€˜Itâ€™s Timeâ€™ for Christmas 2025 in Ad WithÂ Sephora
summary: Carey's holiday season welcome in partnership with Sephora co-stars Billy Eichner.
body: Mariah Carey ‘s welcome to the Christmas season is here. The “All I Want for Christmas Is You” hitmaker made an official announcement to kick off the holidays in partnership with Sephora. “Halloween slayed,” Carey says in the Joseph Kahn-directed ad that dropped as Halloween (Oct. 31) came to a close. “But now … it’s time!” There’s one problem: Someone’s rummaged through the pop diva’s Sephora bag and pilfered the new beauty goodies she snagged for the 2025 holidays. In the lighthearted spot, Carey demands someone spill the tea on who stole her makeup so she can ring in the season of her modern Christmas carol, and — spoiler alert — it’s not the Grinch. It’s Billy Eichner as an overworked elf advocating for better treatment at Christmastime. “Bad news, Mariah Carey,” the comedian taunts. “The elves are striking this year. Elf revenge for putting us through holiday hell! Santa’s helper quit. I’m pawning this so I can afford elf therapy!” “That’s my blush, elf boy,” Carey says. “Your lipstick? I’m taking it. No bells. No châ€¦

title: The Best 2025 Halloween Costumes From Lady Gaga, Megan Thee Stallion, Justin Bieber, Victoria Justice & MoreÂ (Updating)
summary: Here's a roundup of the best 2025 celebrity Halloween costumes.
body: With Halloween falling on a Friday this year, it looks like we’re getting two full weekends of Halloween celebration. Things kicked off last week, with Victoria Justice hosting her “Love Zombie” Halloween & Single Release Party in Los Angeles and embodying her new song by dressing up as the titular undead character. Bette Midler ‘s New York Restoration Project Hulaween Gala hit New York City over the weekend, and Midler hit the red carpet dressed as her own Divine Miss M persona next to Andy Cohen as Andy Warhol. Other celebs at Midler’s party: Ben Platt and husband Noah Galvin as Hugh Hefner and a Playboy Playmate, Darren Criss and wife Mia Criss as New York clowns, and Michael Kors and husband Lance LePere as taxi drivers. Related The 25 Biggest Halloween Songs of All Time on the Hot 100 But some stars didn’t need a party to get dolled up. Paris Hilton took to Instagram to show off her “Oops… I Did It Again!”-era Britney Spears costume , complete with red latex bodysuit. “Oops, I did it again … Starting off #Halloweek by honoring my Queen @BritneySpears,” Hilton captured the series of photos and vidâ€¦

summary: Plus, Lele Pons & Guaynaa celebrate their first Halloween as parents.
body: From career milestones to new music releases to major announcements and those little important moments,  Billboard  editors highlight uplifting moments in Latin music. Hereâ€™s what happened in the Latin music world this week. Kali Uchis to Receive Special Honor Kali Uchis has been named a 2025 ASCAP Women Behind the Music, alongside honorees Kehlani and KPop Demon Huntersâ€™ lead vocalist EJAE. â€œEvery year, ASCAP looks forward to spotlighting some of musicâ€™s most extraordinary women by honoring them for their achievements at our Women Behind the Music event,â€ said Nicole George-Middleton, ASCAP Executive Vice President & Head of Creative Membership, in a statement. â€œThis year we are thrilled to recognize three women who are pushing boundaries and capturing the world’s attention across different genres. Their creative success has propelled them to the top of the charts and is set to inspire the next generation of women in music.â€ The Colombian artist will receive her award at the 17 th annual ASCAP Women Behind the Music event, taking place Wednesday, Nov. 12 in Los Angeles, just weeks after her Superstar Q&A at the 2025 Billboard Latin Music Week in Miami lastâ€¦

summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.
